17.title: The City
17.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: A young black man admires an older white guy's car; the driver stares at him and screeches away, bumping over a curb.
From an alternative paper in Toronto.

18.title: The City
18.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: Empty, rocky plain with signs that say "future site" and "coming soon."

19.title: The City
19.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: Proposes giving all government functions to corporations, including parks, prisons, social security, and schools.

20.title: The City
20.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: Customer compliments the pizza but suggests getting rid of the rap music; it's soul; she says whatever and turns to show her Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Museum souvenir jacket.

21.title: The City
21.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: Answers the door to find trick-or-treaters dressed as property-value-threatening minorities, and their realtor; longs for the days of Freddy Krueger.

22.title: The City
22.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: Gifts recommended are the Uzi-Squirt 2000, Kathie Lee Gifford's Li'l Sweatshop, the Tickle-Me Marv Albert, and the Cop-and-Plunger Playset.

23.title: The City
23.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: Silent single panel, in which a television viewer's head seems to be exploding in a reflection of the Sept. 11, 2001 terrorist strikes at the World Trade Center.

24.title: The City
24.author: by Derf.
notes: Summary: A two-year-old is shown playing, days after the hijack terrorist strikes of Sept. 11, 2001.
